title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer
detail:
Leading technology provider for the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industries, Serva Health, is seeking a talented and experienced Software Developer Engineer to join our team!

Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States without need for future sponsorship. We are not looking for contract (C2C) or consultant hires at this time.

Compensation: Commensurate with experience. Approximately $65,000/yr to $95,000/yr for less experienced candidates and $95,000/yr to $135,000/yr for more senior level candidates.

Location: Full-time in-office role at 1000 Bishops Gate Blvd Mount Laurel, NJ 08054. Relocation assistance is available but not visa sponsorship.

Serva Health’s Benefits Offerings:

At Serva, our people are the core of what we do. We know that the employees that work for us matter just as much as the clients that work with us.

Dental, Medical (HSA), and Vision Insurance (employer subsidized)
Long Term Disability, Life / AD&D Insurance, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
401(k) Plan with Employer Match
Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
Continued training investment
Team-oriented environment with customizable workspace opportunities and company outings
Quarterly profit-sharing plan
Serve a noble purpose by helping patients get access to life-altering drugs

Software Developer Engineer Summary:

For over a decade, Serva Health is a premier provider of innovative technology and patient-centric support to the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries with an elite group of professionals that are smart, driven and passionate about making a difference. We are seeking a Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer to add to our growing SaaS technology development business unit. We work on exciting projects that will challenge and help you to grow your software development skills. This position will be supported by a Sr. Software Engineer who will provide guidance and mentorship for success in the role.

Software Developer Engineer Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent concentration from an accredited U.S. based institution
3+ years of post-Bachelor’s experience minimum
Good understanding of Agile software development practices
A true love of software engineering and application development
Must be a self-starter
Must be comfortable working independently or as part of a team
Proven ability to be successful at software engineering and to learn new skills quickly

Software Developer Engineer Technical Qualifications:

ASP.NET and C# development experience
SQL RDL experience
Experience with front-end responsive frameworks (such as Bootstrap)
MS SQL Server experience
Client-side scripting: JavaScript, jQuery, and any new popular framework is a plus (Angular JS, Node etc.)
.NET Core
React.js, Vue.js, and other client-side technologies
MVC architecture experience/comfort
Experience or interest within in the healthcare, clinical trial, pharmaceutical industries, or with a biopharma or CRO preferred

Who You Are:

Ability to work in the Mt Laurel, New Jersey office full time – Mt Laurel is a beautiful community touting great schools and a safe community. Philly adjacent, Mt Laurel offers all the attractions of a large city within a commutable distance and the shore within an hour!
Have a true love of software engineering and application development
Ability to excel in an agile/scrum software development environment
You value the input and ideas of others without fear and can celebrate their contribution

Who We Are:

Serva Health provides high-engagement patient support solutions and services at the best possible value through relationship-focused patient interactions, an innovative staffing and operations model, and industry-leading technologies. From clinical research patient recruiting and retention to commercial patient support programs, Serva Health has the technology and people solutions to drive superior outcomes.

At Serva Health, we are seeking employees who like to have fun and laugh together and who will bring enthusiasm and energy to a new vision of office life, with an expanded Serva Health Fitness Center, and Gaming/Relaxation Lounge, Free Food Fridays, and of course have a common shared passion for making a difference in patient outcomes in the healthcare/pharm/biotech industries.

Join our team of elite software developers, who have been chosen to work on projects for the largest Silicon Valley tech companies on the planet. We welcome all those that seek a new and exciting opportunity to expand their career horizons in this incredible company.

job summary:

This is a part of Cisco's Engineering Orchestration and Architecture business unit. You'll be a part of team that helps with developing and designing full stack applications using a variety of architectures. The orchestration component is specifically supporting Cisco's Enterprise networking products based on Kubernetes.








Solid full stack development skills in Python (Django, Flask), Javascript and/or similar technologies.
Good understanding of REST APIs, JSON, Experience with Postgres, MongoDB Redis, Asynchonous Task Management
Solid frontend development skills, particularly in React or similar technologies
Unit testing, E2E testing, Selenium Docker, K8s*, Helm* Elasticsearch, Grafana Git, CI/CD, Jenkins
Preferred: Passionate about developer production and efficiency Ability to learn new technologies quickly strong communication skills, both verbal and written

title: Full Stack Engineer
Full-stack Engineer
detail:
job summary:



Randstad Technologies USA is seeking a skilled Full-stack Engineer for a contract role in Seattle, WA. If you are ready to join a leader in the Retail and Technology space, please apply and Randstad will be more than happy to assist you land your next role in the Technology space. We look forward to speaking with you!





location: Seattle, Washington

job type: Contract

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors



responsibilities:



Here is some more info around the Lead Engineer (or a Senior Engineer II level) opening on my team:







The Senior Engineer II is the technical leader for a product team (my teams are specifically: Footwear, Campaigns & Community, Storytelling, Bra Quiz & Sizing, and Reviews & User Generated Content so this role would span all of these).







They are considered the technical owners of the production systems they work on and focus on how their products are delivered and how to optimize them for efficiency, security and reliability. Senior Engineer IIs may participate in on-call rotations and would provide and escalation point for production issues.







At this level, Senior Engineer IIs increase their strategic involvement. Senior Engineers IIs would dedicate a fair amount of time to the planning and discovery of tools and practices inside their given area of expertise. Working closely with Staff Engineers to promote platform level change. Senior Engineer IIs take production readiness and performance personally and help drive continuous improvement.





The Senior Engineer II is the top-level Engineer for a product team. They guide the future state of the product and work to optimize and evolve it to support our engineering standards.





The Senior Engineer II works with their local team to build and optimize a developed product or tool. They may be found working on platform teams, but usually focusing on select products or tools.





The Senior Engineer II owns their product from a DevOps standpoint. This means that they are the driving force behind the implementation of security fixes, the quality process, and all things related to delivery of a product. They would be responsible for surfacing supporting metrics and ensuring that their product exceeds the reliability expectations and SLOs they set.





The Senior Engineer II is the technical lead for a product team, they would work closely with stakeholders to establish team direction and delivery goals. They would lead a Community of Practice centred around product adoption and education.





The Senior Engineer II is the main contributor to their product roadmap. They work with Managers and Directors to ensure that product development is appropriately funded and well defined for yearly/quarterly planning initiatives. The Senior Engineer II is a regular presence in Architecture and Engineering review boards and leads these efforts for their product.





The Senior Engineer II is seen as an expert in their field, and they apply that skill, hands-on, towards the more challenging elements of their product delivery. They are mentors to other Engineers on their team and are often sharing best practices and optimization recommendations. They understand their development life cycle and work with their team to improve velocity and report key delivery metrics.





The Senior Engineer II dedicates part of their time to researching new techniques and tooling to evolve their product. They are open minded when it comes to roadmap decisions and focus on the end goals over the currently deployed technologies.





Hard skills:






5+ years experience in React.js, Next.js, and micro frontends in building web applications
5+ years experience with Python in AWS environment (if no Python experience but has Node.js I would be open to that)
Interest to work across FE and BE
BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Ability to work independently with minimal direction- a self-starter with strong initiative, and ability to manage/execute workload to deliver high quality results
GraphQL nice to have
Previous ecommerce experience nice to have
Experience integrating web frontends with complex multi-tier applications nice to have






Soft skills:






Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.
Communicates with honesty and kindness and creates the space for others to do the same.
Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn't take themselves too seriously.





qualifications:




Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 5 years of experience
Education: Bachelors


skills:
nodeJS (4 years of experience is required)
Python

title: Full-stack Engineer
Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Greetings,
Experis, a Manpower Group company has an exciting contract opportunity for a Full Stack Engineer role at Durham NC 27709. This position is a 6+ month contract for one of our key Financial clients, that offers IT for applications in Financial industry.




Job Details:
Industry: Financial
Job Role: Full Stack Engineer
Location: Durham NC 27709
Duration: 6+ Months. (Possibility for extension)

Primary Responsibilities
Working on various small medium and large scale projects.
Do Systems Analysis of user stories
Research code to understand how existing infrastructure works and recommend designs to address changes. Document technical alternatives and recommend strategy.
Develop changes and adhere to Design / Development review processes.
Unit test and support code during QA testing phase.
Provide environment support as code moves through development integration acceptance and production environments.
Communicate issues progress and status to all levels of the organization.
Conform to secure coding standards.
Deliver high quality work under tight deadlines
Work on multiple projects simultaneously
Should be willing and able to work with various technologies and programming languages. Our applications use Java/J2EE and run on Linux

Requirements

Minimum of 6-8 years development experience
5 years Java experience.
Good knowledge of Spring framework and at least 3 years of experience working on Spring based projects.
Experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit and Mockito.
Experience working in a SOA infrastructure preferable. Hands on experience working with webservices: SOAP or REST preferred.
Knowledge of client-side technologies such as JavaScript HTML5 and JQuery
Good knowledge of development build tools Git Maven Jenkins
Experience with Object Oriented Analysis and Design
Experience with Agile Methodology a plus
Bachelor's Degree or applicable work experience plus 5 years of experience in a software engineering and development role

Thank You!
Shyam Chavan
https://www.linkedin.com/in/shyam-chavan-b0b312a3/

title: Full Stack Engineer
Remote Full Stack Engineer
detail:
As the Full Stack Engineer, you will work with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to analyze, architect and build solutions based on business needs.

Client Details

The client is a Fortune 500 Company in the beauty and retail space. They have a strong commitment to company culture, work life balance, and creating a diverse workforce.

Description



You will be working with a team of skilled Full Stack Developers to implement Omnichannel capabilities, with a focus on providing excellent user experience


Work with Perl and PHP on the Backend to expand the use of React


Work with the team leadership and business owners to define scalable technical solutions


Code review and mentor junior Engineers



Profile



You have 2+ years of Front End Web Development experience with expertise in JavaScript


You have 3+ years of Back End Development experience with expertise in Perl, PHP, or NodeJS


You have experience mentoring engineers and working with the product teams to define and drive solutions


You have experience working with an Agile team and with Jira


Experience with React is a plus



Job Offer



Hourly rates ranging from $80-$90/hr


Opt-In benefits through Michael Page


Work remotely from anywhere in the United States


8 hour days and 40 hour weeks


Collaborative and inclusive work environment


Click Apply to have your resume considered



MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.

You will be working with a team of skilled Full Stack Developers to implement Omnichannel capabilities, with a focus on providing excellent user experience


Work with Perl and PHP on the Backend to expand the use of React


Work with the team leadership and business owners to define scalable technical solutions


Code review and mentor junior Engineers



Profile



You have 2+ years of Front End Web Development experience with expertise in JavaScript


You have 3+ years of Back End Development experience with expertise in Perl, PHP, or NodeJS


You have experience mentoring engineers and working with the product teams to define and drive solutions


You have experience working with an Agile team and with Jira


Experience with React is a plus



Job Offer



Hourly rates ranging from $80-$90/hr


Opt-In benefits through Michael Page


Work remotely from anywhere in the United States


8 hour days and 40 hour weeks


Collaborative and inclusive work environment


Click Apply to have your resume considered



MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. title: Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE (3977)
detail:
Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE







Why you want to work at Flexion:




We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer that is looking for an opportunity to grow their DevOps Engineering skills and knowledge. We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer with expertise in .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages that is interested in expanding their skillset to include Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure configuration and automation. . You will have an unwavering passion for working in autonomous, cross-functional, self-organized teams to build complex systems using lean, agile mindsets-this means delivering incremental business value with each sprint and enabling options at all scales. For this project, you and your team will be modernizing a critical state government system and helping to improve the lives of millions of state residents.







At Flexion (an agile software company that's been delivering excellence for over 24 years), our company culture is built on autonomy, trust, and transparency. We empower teams to remain autonomous and self-organized by hiring people who can solve complex problems by functioning collaboratively-this means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles (business application software engineering, database engineering, DevSecOps, security engineering, etc.) as needed. Every member within a cross-functional team is a leader who takes responsibility for the entire team's success, which mirrors the company's overall flat structure.







What the job looks like:




You'll be part of a multi-disciplinary, agile application development team tasked with modernizing an enterprise government system. The project work is primarily remote but may require some client on-site work estimated at <5%.





Mobbing and pairing with your team to design, code, test, debug, deploy and document software in an agile environment


Working with your team, supporting agile engineering practices such as delivering small narrow slices of functionality, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment, and Infrastructure as Code


Working with UX/UI Designers, DevSecOps Engineers, Full Stack Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Data Analysts to modernize a 50 year old legacy system


Tackle a wide variety of technical problems


Exercise your full tool-belt of skills and experience








Why we want to hire you:




You thrive working in a dynamic environment and think, design, and code with the knowledge that things will change. You want to work with team members that challenge you every day. You demonstrate an unwavering commitment to human-centered agility, quality, and technical excellence. You have read and have a strong alignment to our Flexion Fundamentals.







You have:





5+ years of software engineering experience


An interest in increasing your DevOps Engineering skills and experience


A bachelor's degree or commensurate experience


Self-motivated with strong communication and collaboration skills


Passion for learning new technologies and the ability to do so quickly


Ability to write high-quality code efficiently


Agile software development experience


Advanced knowledge and experience with .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages


Experience building service-oriented APIs


Experience with Google Cloud or AWS Cloud platforms or Azure


Experience building applications that integrate application logging, monitoring and alerting


Experience automating Cloud Platform infrastructure using Terraform/CloudFormation desired


DevOps, Continuous Delivery & Automation using tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Packer, CloudBees Jenkins, Nexus desired


Experience modernizing legacy mainframe systems desired


Experience solving complex problems and implementing solutions for performance and scalability








At Flexion, we live by these principles:





Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutions


Welcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warning


Collaborate online in small groups about 50% of the time


Encourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options open


Expect and vocally advocate for quality first


Learn new practices and techniques as the situation demands


Ensure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or two


Do what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitude


Dig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutions


Relentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes








The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided. If you have questions or would like more information about this job posting or if you'd like to know more about Flexion Inc. in general, please contact a dedicated recruiter at (608) 352-0360.







Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer




If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 608-205-8868 for assistance.

title: Java Full Stack Engineer
Lead Full Stack Engineer
detail:
job summary:



We are looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer to work a hybrid role, requiring 2 days a week (Tuesdays and Thursdays) on-site in Dallas, TX. The remaining 3 - days can be worked from home.






Must haves: Node, React and preferably PostgreSQL but any relational database is fine
Nice to have: AWS or Azure, CI/CD, React Native, MongoDB, leadership experience
This individual will be working on all parts of the application; someone with B2C experience is a plus;
We are looking for a servant leader, someone who is proactive, friendly and focused



location: Dallas, Texas

job type: Permanent

salary: $140,000 - 150,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors



responsibilities:



We are looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer to work a hybrid role, requiring 2 days a week (Tuesdays and Thursdays) on-site in Dallas, TX. The remaining 3 - days can be worked from home.






Must haves: Node, React and preferably PostgreSQL but any relational database is fine
Nice to have: AWS or Azure, CI/CD, React Native, MongoDB, leadership experience,
This individual will be working on all parts of the application; someone with B2C experience is a plus;
We are looking for a servant leader, someone who is proactive, friendly and focused
This individual will need to be in Dallas and go into the office 2x a week (Tuesday and Thursday) for whiteboarding discussions and to meet with the marketing and operations teams
Big selling points: This individual will be working with cutting edge technology and the applications are constantly evolving. Due to company growth, the goal is to package the platform and sell it to other companies. This is a new platform and you will also have opportunity to work with some R&D.
Culture: when in office, business casual to business dress code; have employee events for people to get together; since it's a flat organization, employees don't need to go through a lot of layers to talk to people on other teams
You'll spend 50% of your time coding, other 50% will be spent leading, talking to the business side, gathering requirements, and making architecture decisions.

Minimum 5 years of experience
Education: Bachelors (required)

Fidelity Personal Investing - Client Solutions Technology Chapter Area is looking for a hardworking Senior Full Stack Engineer to build and support world-class products for the technology teams in our One Stop Life Shop domain. Our engineering team is innovative, diverse, passionate and dedicated. We work in a very dynamic agile environment





As a hands-on engineer, your primary role will be building, testing and engineering web applications using modern technologies like Angular, NodeJS, Graph QL, and REST APIs on AWS cloud. You will be encouraged to quickly gain understanding of all the components of our web applications and will work with the team to deliver outstanding solutions.

Driven by a passionate and dedicated team, we are a enterprise SaaS company in the digital health space committed to revolutionizing the way surgeries are coordinated. As a Full Stack Engineer you will take part in the development of our growing platform utilizing scrum methodology.
This is a unique opportunity for a tech-savvy individual to take part in shaping the future of Digital Health, and Surgical Scheduling in particular.

Why join us?

As a Full Stack Ruby on Rails Engineer we offer the following:

Competitive Base Salary ($130K-$150K)
Strong Benefits Package
Competitive PTO Plan
100% Remote


Job Details

Your skills:

description:
As a full stack engineer, you will have a hand in every step of the SDLC. From .NET Core development to the latest versions of Angular, you'll contribute to building cloud-native applications with our distributed architecture. This role provides the opportunity to enhance any aspect of our existing applications and develop brand new products from end to end. Downstream, you will have the opportunity to dive into products and solutions with Machine Learning and AI components. This is a collaborative environment where you will learn from others, while having your voice heard.

Major projects include (but not limited to)

A B2B ecommerce platform for retailers of the food industry
A B2B digital platform for suppliers of the food industry
A top-tier virtual marketing show experience built entirely online
Charity hackathons and contributions to "Make Lives Better"

What you bring:

Programming experience using C# with .NET Core / .NET Framework
Relational database experience with data modeling, reporting, query optimization, indexing a SQL Datastore
Experience within scrum teams and familiarity with Agile methodologies
Hands-on experience in development and testing phases of the development life cycle
Understanding basics of cloud-based architecture (We use AWS)
API development
Front end development using Angular

title: Full Stack Engineer
Senior Software Engineer Ruby
subTitle:
KUBRA
54 reviews
Arizona
description:
Overview

Are you interested in joining a dynamic team, passionate about making the world a better and more sustainable place? We are on a quest to improve water efficiency, reduce water's substantial carbon footprint, and save people money. We use elegant technology (Ruby, React, and ReactNative) to build beautiful web and mobile apps that help people understand and manage their water use in real-time. Along the way, we get to explore fascinating time-series datasets, employ machine learning to conserve precious resources, support open source projects, and hang out with some pretty cool people.

What you get to do every day

Write and review Ruby and Javascript code
Design, develop and maintain sophisticated APIs, web applications, and native mobile apps
Operate a cloud-based, multi-tenant customer engagement platform
Collaborate with clients, users, management, and other engineers on product roadmap, architecture development plans, and program launches
Help to hire, train and mentor other software engineers

What kind of person should you be?

You are passionate about clean code, elegant architecture, and easy operation
You are dedicated to creating beautiful and informative user experiences
You are enthusiastic about continuously improving processes, products, tools and technologies
You are opinionated yet actively seek information and insights that contradict those opinions
You are reliable, kind, and comfortable with eccentric coworkers

What skills do you need?

Minimum of 5 years experience developing web or mobile applications
Experience (or strong interest) in Ruby and Javascript
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Experience in full-stack development – including frontend, backend, database, deployment, and operations – is preferred
Experience with Amazon AWS cloud services (EC2, S3, RDS, etc) is preferred

What can you expect from us?

Award-winning culture that fosters growth, diversity and inclusion for all
Paid day off for your birthday
Access to LinkedIn learning courses
Continued education with our education reimbursement program
Flexible schedules
Two paid days for volunteer opportunities

KUBRA is a fast-growing company that delivers customer communications solutions to some of the largest utility, insurance, and government entities across North America. KUBRA offers billing and payments, mapping, mobile apps, proactive communications, and artificial intelligence solutions for customers. With more than 1.5 billion customer interactions annually, KUBRA services reach over 40% of households in the U.S. and Canada. KUBRA is an operating subsidiary of Hearst.

Our office is small enough to allow creative individuals to flourish, yet large enough to provide long-term stability. We place a tremendous amount of responsibility on our team members to be productive, focused and self-motivated. We offer a casual work environment, competitive compensation and a stellar benefits program.

KUBRA is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

description:
REMOTE Role for Full Stack Developer, has to be in USA.

Attempt to farm out this job would not work. Interview is video so are the scrums for the selected candidate.

Requirements:

Track record delivering front-end software that is correct, stable, performant, secure, and accessibility compliant.
Minimum 3+ years of SPA development experience on a framework [VueJS would be a plus]
Proficient in a broad range of software design approaches and common UX patterns. Knows when (and when not) to use front-end software design patterns (e.g., asynchronicity, data binding, modules, objects, promises).
Proficient in view layout and rendering technologies (e.g., responsiveness, progressive enhancement, browser/device support). Knows when it is appropriate to make graceful fallbacks.
Experience with frontend data or visualization frameworks (preferably D3 and Plotly) is a plus
Experience with REST APIs
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English

What you'll do:

100% remote work with a team of other developers and QA engineers to deliver new business values within a product development team
Work with your Product Owner to refine, design and implement business case improvements
Implement processes and functionalities within a large eco-system of microservices all the while focusing on frontend code only

Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour

Monday to Friday

description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Our Lockheed Martin Transformation Program (1LMX) is changing how work is done at Lockheed Martin. On the Enterprise Control Tower – Sales, Inventory, Operation and Planning agile team is focused on creating services that will be used across the enterprise to aid our supply chain, manufacturing and sustainment customers.

We are seeking a highly motivated, creative Full Stack Engineer to facilitate our digital transformation efforts.

You'll be....
Responsible for development of IT solutions across all components of software systems through design, integration, implementation and support.
Basic Qualifications:
Must be highly proficient in SQL, Java, software development, architecture and systems integration.

Experience with frontend, backend, database, and REST/SOAP/other service types.

Expertise with SQL, Java, and/or Javascript languages/ Libraries.

Proficiency with at least one relational DB (PostgreSQL, SQLServer, MySQL, etc.)

Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 2 years of professional experience; or no experience required with a related Masters degree. Considered experienced, but still a learner.

Green Card holder or US Citizen due to system access
Desired Skills:
Experience with CI/CD development

Experience using agile development practices and DevOps technology stacks preferred.

Data engineering AWS and/or Azure cloud environment

Data virtualization, especially with TIBCO; coordinating with and integrating external data sources

Experience visualizing data in Tableau

Git and Gitlab-CI

Proficiency with Docker and Docker-compose

Configuration and deployment of applications using Openshift/Kubernetes

Java Spring and Springboot, Maven

NodeJS, React, MaterialUI

Agile product team experience and familiarity with Agile tools (Jira)


Incorporating authentication standards and security protocols: OAuth, SAML, TLS, etc.

Experience supporting a virtual team

Other: SAP and P2P, AWS, Python, performance testing, XML and JSON Schema, OAGIS BOD
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Virtual role)
Full Stack Engineer - Remote
subTitle:
ProductPlan
Santa Barbara, CA 93101
Remote
description:
We’re looking for people who are passionate about creating great products.

Do you believe culture and craft are best played as a team sport? That being kind to one another is part of the job? Then you will fit right in to our fantastic Engineering team. We move quickly but thoughtfully. We're rigorous without ivory tower institutions. We love building and technology, but we're customer obsessed first.

At ProductPlan, we believe in doing what matters—and that begins with the culture we create. Our values are Heart, Humility, and Hustle. Together we work hard, laugh hard, and support one another to build the product roadmap software behind today’s leading companies.

If that sounds exciting to you, read on!

What you'll do

Be an active part of our software delivery cycle. From ideation to deployment and everything in between, your contributions will make a difference.
Work with Product and Design to craft efficient, performant, and delightful user experiences.
Contribute to our full stack web application, crafted with PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Ruby on Rails, and React.
Work on a small, product-focused team of 3-4 engineers; that will build innovative customer experiences.
Write high quality and well tested code to meet our customer’s needs.
Take ownership and work collaboratively to solve problems.

Who you are

You have 2 or more years of software development experience preferably developing SaaS software.
You have 2 or more years of experience with React and Ruby on Rails or related technologies.
You’ve got an eye for the beautiful design our users expect and your attention to detail extends down to the very last pixel.
You are a First Principles thinker who is able to work with others to come up with pragmatic solutions.
You have strong product instincts and take pride in understanding customers.
You aim to implement sustainable and flexible patterns that will help maintain an ever-evolving and growing product.
You get excited about figuring out solutions to complex problems and enjoy executing those solutions even more!

Psst! Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. We want to be super clear: we don’t believe in perfect candidates (or people!). ProductPlan is a place where everyone can grow. However you identify and whatever background you bring with you, if this is a role that would make you fired up to come into work every day, please apply.

About Us
Friends, coworkers, trivia nuts, musical wizards, moms, dads, engineers, designers, worm farmers, bee keepers, marketers, support, human beings. Originally, we created ProductPlan to liberate people from building roadmaps using cumbersome tools like spreadsheets and slide decks. It's been amazing to watch it grow into what it is today—a system of record for product-led companies, worldwide.

ProductPlan was founded in 2013 with headquarters in Santa Barbara, California. Our talented distributed team is now located all over the world.

ProductPlan has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture. We look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We value ownership, craftsmanship, investment in ourselves, quality communication, and a healthy work life balance. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

What to Expect
When you interview, we'd like to get to know you as a person and a coder.

As a person, we’re looking for someone who demonstrates our values: Heart, Humility, and Hustle. We look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, own solutions end to end, and expect sustained efficient performance. We seek people with the desire to build and share expertise in crafting simple, intuitive solutions, in whatever way is relevant to their role.

As a coder, we’d like to learn about your philosophy on how to write maintainable code and how to write interfaces that others can use and build upon.

This is a US-based remote position. You'll be part of a remote-first work culture where all meetings are online and we use apps like Slack and Zoom to communicate.

Job Type: Full-time

You have 2 or more years of experience with React and Ruby on Rails or related technologies.
You’ve got an eye for the beautiful design our users expect and your attention to detail extends down to the very last pixel.
You are a First Principles thinker who is able to work with others to come up with pragmatic solutions.
You have strong product instincts and take pride in understanding customers.
You aim to implement sustainable and flexible patterns that will help maintain an ever-evolving and growing product.
You get excited about figuring out solutions to complex problems and enjoy executing those solutions even more!

Psst! Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. We want to be super clear: we don’t believe in perfect candidates (or people!). ProductPlan is a place where everyone can grow. However you identify and whatever background you bring with you, if this is a role that would make you fired up to come into work every day, please apply.

About Us
Friends, coworkers, trivia nuts, musical wizards, moms, dads, engineers, designers, worm farmers, bee keepers, marketers, support, human beings. Originally, we created ProductPlan to liberate people from building roadmaps using cumbersome tools like spreadsheets and slide decks. It's been amazing to watch it grow into what it is today—a system of record for product-led companies, worldwide.

ProductPlan was founded in 2013 with headquarters in Santa Barbara, California. Our talented distributed team is now located all over the world.

ProductPlan has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture. We look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We value ownership, craftsmanship, investment in ourselves, quality communication, and a healthy work life balance. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

What to Expect
When you interview, we'd like to get to know you as a person and a coder.

As a person, we’re looking for someone who demonstrates our values: Heart, Humility, and Hustle. We look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, own solutions end to end, and expect sustained efficient performance. We seek people with the desire to build and share expertise in crafting simple, intuitive solutions, in whatever way is relevant to their role.

As a coder, we’d like to learn about your philosophy on how to write maintainable code and how to write interfaces that others can use and build upon.

This is a US-based remote position. You'll be part of a remote-first work culture where all meetings are online and we use apps like Slack and Zoom to communicate.

description:
Metadata is looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our team. The team is responsible for building a real-time behaviour tracking and analytics framework that allows customers to build real-time personalized web experiences and landing pages.

This role will be responsible for driving end to end features from design & implementation, through to testing. The ideal candidate has experience building robust and scalable features with Python, and a passion to dive deep into challenging code. An understanding of process execution, monitoring, and optimization is a plus.

Be responsible for driving end to end features from design& implementation, through testing
Have experience building robust and scalable features with Python
Have a passion to dive deep into challenging code
Have an understanding of process execution, monitoring, and optimization
Implement and ship features for digital behavior tracking, analytics engine and integrated frameworks
Develop high-quality, production ready code that can be used by millions of users of our on-demand platform
Adopt, embrace, and promote agile and test-driven practices with your peers
Value team excellence over individual productivity

Experience with building APIs and services using REST
Experience with Big Data platforms and SQL knowledge
Comfortable with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) & command line

description:
Symetra has an exciting new opportunity to join our Emerging Solutions team as a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer!

Symetra has headquarters is in Bellevue, Washington. It has over 2000 employees with more than $60 Billion in assets. Established in 1957, and well positioned to execute on growth plans.

At Symetra, we 're focused on building solutions which can help people gain financial freedom. We are disrupting Insurance industry. We won 2021 Gartner Eye on Innovation Award for Financial Services and 2022 Celent Model Insurer Award. We're creating new products to redefine the industry, and we invite you to join us in the adventure! This is a unique opportunity to innovate and bring dependable solutions with delightful user experiences to our customers.

About the role

You'll be joining an engineering team that is responsible for the care and feeding of an award-winning, high performing, reliable, secure, and scalable technology platform. This platform integrates best of the breed SaaS solutions in a cloud native environment complex architecture. We are looking for engineers who are passionate, team players and poised to make difference. You will understand the vision and work on strategy-execution to build the life insurance product on Serverless architecture.

This role is for Symetra’s Swift program for life insurance – SwiftTerm or SwiftPerm.

What you’ll do

You are fully responsible full life cycle of the code – design developing, deploying, and operationalizing.
Design, build, document, implement and operationalize highly scalable, available, reliable API’s that are continuously deployed and updated through an automated CI/CD pipeline. Enable user analytics, logging, monitoring, instrumentation for all services.
Write unit, integration, and performance tests. Build shared libraries that can used enterprise wide.
Lead design and code reviews. Translating resulting software design and wireframes into high-quality code.
Collaborate with various team members and stakeholders on requirements definition and feature design and development.
Be an agent of Agile thinking to deliver testable and re-usable software iteratively.
Participate in requirements definition, UX development, and customer support.
Bring product mindset, identify opportunities for improving application functionality and performance issues by working with customers and architecture resources.



What will differentiate you?

Proven past technical accomplishments and a GitHub link

You are proactive, thrive in a startup like environment with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility building customer focus product.




What we offer you

Benefits and Perks

We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better both at work and at home.

Flexible full-time or hybrid telecommuting arrangements
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
Paid time away including vacation and sick time, flex days and ten paid holidays
Give back to your community and double your impact through our company matching

Want more details? Want more details? Check out our Symetra Benefits Overview opens a pdf file

Salary Range: $115,600 - $192,700 plus eligibility for the company annual bonus program target of 10%.




Your skills and experience

5+ years of software development experience as engineer in an agile environment with excellent design, problem solving and debugging skills
4+ years of hands-on coding experience in two or more languages - JavaScript, Type Script, AngularJS, NodeJS, Springboot framework, Swift, Kotlin, ReactJS or Flutter.
3+ years of experience building and deploying efficient code, creating complex architecture and development patterns.
2+ year of experience building Cloud native Serverless architecture, microservice design, integration patterns with domain driven and secure partner facing APIs. Experience with AWS Cognito, AWS Lex, AWS App Sync, AWS Lambda, Mobile App development is strongly preferred
1 + Experience with NoSQL (DynamoDB) for data management and database scheme design is desirable
With little or no supervision, capable of analyzing, planning, designing and owning complex or vaguely defined issues
Collaborative attitude that incorporates various perspectives and puts customer before technology
Strong communication skills with technical and non-technical peers
Experience in DevOps and Agile methodologies
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science preferred

We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we’re building a place where every employee feels valued, respected, and has opportunities to contribute. Inclusion is about recognizing our assumptions, considering multiple perspectives, and removing barriers.

We accept and celebrate diverse experiences, identities, and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and builds a stronger, more innovative company. We invite you to learn more about our efforts here.

For more information about our careers visit www.symetra.com/careers.

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

title: Sr. Full Stack Engineer - Remote
Jr. Full Stack Engineer, Influence
subTitle:
Liftoff
San Francisco, CA
Remote
description:
Liftoff is the leading growth acceleration platform for the mobile industry, helping advertisers, publishers, game developers and DSPs scale revenue growth with solutions to market and monetize mobile apps.

Liftoff's solutions, including Accelerate, Direct, Influence, Monetize, Intelligence, and Vungle Exchange, support over 6,600 mobile businesses across 74 countries in sectors such as gaming, social, finance, ecommerce, and entertainment. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in Redwood City, CA, Liftoff has a diverse, global presence.

About Liftoff

At Liftoff, we're solving one of the core problems faced by every mobile app: growth. To do so, we build Machine Learning and Big Data-driven technology that can accurately predict which apps a user will like, and connect them in a compelling way. Our systems operate at a scale unseen outside of the largest Internet companies - processing over 4 million requests per second and interacting with over a billion users a week. Our technology is innovative and we have strong product-market fit; as a result, we're profitable and seeing tremendous growth.

Across our engineering teams, we offer a wide range of opportunities for different skill levels and experiences.

About Product Engineering at Influence
Engineering at Influence is different, by design. We are product engineers, first and foremost. We value shipping a product to our customers that creates an immediate and meaningful impact in their interactions with our platform. We place far less of an emphasis on using the most trendy engineering frameworks, technologies or topics - we prioritize user experience and the inherent value of iterating over purity of product. The product engineering team works in a highly collaborative environment with the business stakeholders, directly negotiating requirements without the added layer of a formalized product or program management department. Engineers join Influence for the focus on product, the ability to ship lots of products, fast, and the no-ego, level-disregarding collaboration that is fostered across the entire company. Our founders still actively push code and launch new features, we aim to embody the "no job is too small for me" mindset.
Location

This role is eligible to work out of any of our below North America office locations or is eligible for full-time remote work in one of our entities.

US office locations: Redwood City (HQ), San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Austin (office in 2022)

Additionally, Liftoff recently announced approved North American locations from which some employees may request to work from any city and county: California, Colorado, Idaho, Illinois, Georgia, Missouri, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Texas, Utah and Washington in the US, and Canada.



What You'll Do
Work across the stack, specifically with Node.JS, PostgreSQL and React in a Google Cloud Platform environment
Partner with the Growth, Media, Community, Creator and Advertiser Teams to ideate and execute nuanced features and products for the creator economy
Drive and own the delivery of software components from inception to production
Partner with fellow product engineers to review code and improve code quality

What You've Done

Recent experience architecting, designing and implementing products within a new system or existing platform
Shipped consumer-facing products, ideally mobile-first products with accompanying web applications
Experience mentoring and developing engineers with or without a formal leadership title
Meaningful exposure to mobile development challenges, enough to have opinions around technical choices that may cause downstream impacts to your own work
Bonus Points!
Exposure to machine learning platforms
Exposure to launching iOS and Android applications
Experience working in an early-stage startup environment

Working at Liftoff is fast-paced, fun, and challenging, and we thrive on innovation. Come join our team and help shape the future of the mobile app ecosystem. If this role sounds interesting to you, we would love to hear from you!




#LI-EL1

#LI-Remote

description:
As a full stack engineer at Ronin, you will be working closely with people across engineering, product, and design to build systems and experiences to solve challenges in cancer care. You have proficient knowledge of modern web applications and have worked across the stack from frontend technologies like React to backend services like Kotlin, Java, Rails, or others. . You also have demonstrable experience building REST based systems following services oriented design.

You follow engineering best practices when creating software and you enjoy working collaboratively with other smart but humble engineers in an environment where you feel safe to experiment and innovate. You want to work on a product that has a positive impact on cancer patients’ lives.
Here’s the typical day to day for our full stack engineers:
Collaborate with engineering, product management and design teams to understand customer pain points, come up with solutions that will ultimately better the lives of both Patients, Oncologists, and supporting care teams. Develop seamless user experiences for the Oncologists and care teams using our product.
Develop, test, document and deploy easy to understand and secure backend service APIs to enable the creation of web application features.
Design and implement secure and fault tolerant systems to handle large amounts of health data using container based technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Tackle a wide variety of technical problems throughout the stack and contribute daily to all parts of our product code base as well as our overall quality engineering processes.
Does some or most of the below describe you? Let’s chat!
3-5+ years of experience in working on full-stack, from building frontend web applications, to creating containerized backend services.
Passion for building products that are delightful both outside and inside – from beautiful user experiences to robust technical design.
Experience around deploying backend stacks. (We use Docker and Kubernetes)
Product oriented mindset – you care about the end user experience and provide input into the product.

What We Offer:

We’re a remote-first company within the United States
Competitive salary and equity, based on experience
401k through Guideline
Medical, dental, and vision 100% covered for employees and 70% for dependents
100% covered life insurance for employees
Parental Leave
Flexible vacation: we encourage everyone to take at least 15 days off per year
11 paid company holidays plus a week off during the winter holidays
All the stipends! Learning & development, internet, cell phone, and team lunches
Opportunity to work on impactful products in the complex cancer space

Project Rōnin is filling one of the greatest gaps in patient care to date. Our mission is to increase the length and quality of every persons’ life who has been affected by cancer.

This year alone there will be nearly 1.8 million new cancer diagnoses, and the tools oncologists are using haven’t been updated in 20 years. With our platform, communication between patients and their doctors is optimized through an individual care platform that is already having an immediate impact.

Want to learn more?

Medium
Our Values

Avoid the confidence gap. If some of the above describes you, we’d love to chat and see where your skills can add to our team.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

title: Full Stack Engineer
Sr. Full Stack Developer
subTitle:
RED TECHNOLOGIES
Charlotte, NC 28203
description:
At Red Technologies, we’re changing the way freight moves. Our technology plays an essential role in everything we do and is built to solve the challenges that come with managing freight for our shippers, carriers, and drivers. Our fast-growing company allows for you to bring new ideas to the table while quickly making an impact on the future of our technology.

About The Role:

This full-stack developer role will be frontend focused, responsible for crafting web products, working in modern stacks, taking designs, and translating them into responsive HTML/CSS. This person has a problem-solving foundation and approaches all challenges with a positive drive.

Responsibilities

Timely development, testing, and release of frontend experiences.
Work with headless content management systems to model data
Build out encapsulated reusable components
Work with a variety of web products and applications in a full software development lifecycle
Perform coding, testing, documentation, and implementation of websites including cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, and search engine optimization
Keen attention to detail, aligning with HZ’s high standard of quality
Work with other developers, designers, and product managers to develop new features consistent with the product roadmap
Learn and absorb new technologies quickly, be a strong team player and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands
Be innovative, contributing ideas and working with constituents to evaluate and propose approaches that balance speed to market with code quality
Maintain awareness of technology developments that affect either a user’s ability to use our products or extend new product potential
Able to react to change productively and handle other essential tasks as assigned

Qualifications

Ability to complete and discuss a full stack coding exercise
Experience with backend (server-side) programming and syntax – specifically in data querying and API services
Strong, modern frontend development experience – one or more development frameworks/libraries required (AngularJS, ReactJS, VueJS)
CSS styling and HTML markup experience, preferably experience working with UI/UX designers or self-sufficiently designing pages
Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience working with development utilities (yarn, git, VSCode/Studio)

Why Red Technologies?

Be able to make an immediate impact in a rapidly growing company
Comprehensive training program to set you up for success
Ongoing career development and internal advancement opportunities
Modern, downtown office with a bowling alley and an on-site gym
Casual dress code- Red Technologies gear for the days you can’t decide what to wear
Convenient downtown parking
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance and 401k with employer match

Salary:

$105,000- $145,000

Great Growth: Our fast-growing company allows you to create your own path. We hire people who are driven to succeed, and we back them up with the training and support that helps them grow.

Great People: Work in an inclusive culture with an engaged, energized team of people who are committed to a common vision of doing the little things right.

Great Technology: Red Technologies is a game-changing proprietary software that’s been designed and developed with our shippers, carriers, and drivers in mind.

Great Relationships: We are more than just a broker. Spot is dedicated to making sure every shipment, every customer, and every contract carrier is taken care of. That’s why, no matter what time or day, we're always available.

Great Benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance. Company paid STD and Life insurance. 401k with employer match and Paid Time Off.

#REDTMS

Red Technologies provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Red Technologies is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a disability, you need a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to our Human Resources Department to notify us of your request. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

description:
Job Title: hēRo3 Junior Full Stack Engineer

Salary: $Competitive + excellent benefits (bonus, pension, healthcare, life cover etc.)

Location: Remote (US)

Starting Date: ASAP


About the role

hēRo3 is a new SaaS technology revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a global scale by simplifying advanced economic modeling. hēRo3 is looking to hire a talented, driven Junior Engineer to our development team. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest technology stack, including Node.js, Angular, and our cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, while learning from a skilled group of passionate engineers. Our engineering team embraces the Core Values at PAI, promoting a highly collaborative, team-oriented, agile environment. While you grow as an engineer at PAI, you will be contributing to a software platform that positively impacts the medical industry, and society.

Junior Level Qualifications and Experience:

1-2 years working with JavaScript
1-2 years working with SQL or NoSQL
A desire to learn

Bonus Skills:

Angular or React experience

Benefits and Perks:


Competitive base salary + Bonus
20 vacation days paid time off annually, plus the week between Christmas and New Year off
Paid sick, family leave
Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
401K matching program
100% covered Life Insurance
Company-sponsored recreational outings
Your choice of state-of-the-art hardware/OS: Apple, Windows, or Linux
High definition ultrawide monitor
Work with the latest, cutting-edge software stack and tooling

Working at PAI and HēRo3

A career at PAI focuses on collaboration, hard work, and professional growth. We encourage our employees to continuously learn and to rigorously challenge themselves. Senior staff are involved in active and intensive mentoring of younger employees. We have a positive and collaborative work environment that rewards high performance and commitment to excellence.

About Us

PAI (Policy Analysis Inc.) is a 45+ year old health-economics consultancy located in Boston, Massachusetts. We are an industry leader in the fields of Pharmacoeconomics, outcomes research, quality-of-life assessment, pharmacoepidemiology, and health technology assessment. PAI has developed a new SaaS technology, hēRo3, which is revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a global scale by simplifying advanced economic modeling. We work with top pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies all over the world to make advances in healthcare. In the past year, we have joined the healthcare giant, Fishawack Health. This has afforded us greater opportunities and growth.

Our mission is to integrate our HEOR expertise with advances in data science and technology to speed up studies, make better decisions, and advance human health. This north star guides us in all we do, but equally important is how we accomplish that mission – by working together with honesty and integrity, and by providing a workplace which is inclusive, safe and fair.

Fishawack Health is an equal opportunities employer and place where everyone is welcome. We strongly encourage people from minority backgrounds, LGBTQIA+, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

We encourage all applicants to read our company Privacy Policy before applying to a role.

We’re building a platform for software engineers to build on the cloud faster, better, and more scalably than ever before. Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cloud computing and unlock production-grade deployments for every developer. The next generation of startups will be built using multiple cloud technologies, from standard cloud providers like AWS and GCP to up-and-coming decentralized solutions like IPFS. The future is going to be far more complex, and we need tooling to manage it. We will be the interface to the cloud(s) upon which the next generation of companies is built.

About the Role

You will be in charge of designing and implementing new features, across the Tech Stack. You will work closely with our CTO and other engineers on the team and have the opportunity to make a huge impact. A typical week can include implementing new APIs, designing a new database schema, and crafting a corresponding frontend flow.

We are looking for someone who:
Has experience building GraphQL or REST based microservices with Golang
Has frontend experience with frameworks like React & Typescript
Has experience with message queue, pub sub, distributed data processing
Has experience with modern cloud environments like AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Serverless Functions
Thrives in a small team environment, working closely with customer and engineers


Nice to have
Early-stage tech startup experience
Experience with analytics tooling such as SQL, Metabase, Grafana, Prometheus, Google Analytics
Understand DevOps/SRE process and pain points
Contribution to open source software
Experience with tools like Jenkins, Github Actions, ArgoCD, Pulumi, Terraform


Projects you might work on:
Integrating with new cloud backends
User-facing API to simplify common cloud operation tasks
Extensible build-detection system (a competent engineer can look at a Github repo and figure out most of the infrastructure needed to run it - let's automate that!)
Advanced logs / metrics alerting system
3rd party data integrations (a la Datadog, LogZ, LogDNA)
Additional source control integrations (Private Docker Registry, NixOS Registry, Gitlab, BitBucket)


Disclaimer: This position requires that VanHack uploads your profile to the company's own Applicant Tracking System. After applying and if your profile is a great match, your recruiter will upload your information to the company's platform. They'll reach out directly to you, so it's important to check your inbox and spam folder.

description:
At Eppo, we are building the future of AB experimentation, so that every company can have an entrepreneurial, customer oriented culture. We dramatically lower the overhead of running experiments by automating all of the experiment operations work that typically get pushed to analytics teams, and wrapping the results in collaborative workflows that give confidence in the results.

Your Background

Concretely, we are looking for this combination of attributes and skills:

Attributes

Business owner mindset: you are comfortable making choices in ambiguous situations, and think of the team's success and failure as your own

Bias to action: You have a drive to move forward, and are comfortable using placeholders, straw men, and other temporary solutions when necessary. You resolve ambiguity by action.

Resourceful: The set of technologies and frameworks to use for application building evolves every day. We want to use every tool to accelerate our business, whether it is an open source project, a serverless component, or an external engineer.

Skills

Able to build using Typescript/NextJS with high quality and velocity

Able to build reuseable data visualization components

Able to architect data models needed to build systems in mockups

Compensation

Competitive senior engineer salary and early stage, founding team equity

Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance

New laptop/equipment of your choice and whatever else you need to be productive

Compensation for learning materials, tools and resources to help you learn and grow

title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer
detail:
Leading technology provider for the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industries, Serva Health, is seeking a talented and experienced Software Developer Engineer to join our team!

Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States without need for future sponsorship. We are not looking for contract (C2C) or consultant hires at this time.

Compensation: Commensurate with experience. Approximately $65,000/yr to $95,000/yr for less experienced candidates and $95,000/yr to $135,000/yr for more senior level candidates.

Location: Full-time in-office role at 1000 Bishops Gate Blvd Mount Laurel, NJ 08054. Relocation assistance is available but not visa sponsorship.

Serva Health’s Benefits Offerings:

At Serva, our people are the core of what we do. We know that the employees that work for us matter just as much as the clients that work with us.

Dental, Medical (HSA), and Vision Insurance (employer subsidized)
Long Term Disability, Life / AD&D Insurance, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
401(k) Plan with Employer Match
Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
Continued training investment
Team-oriented environment with customizable workspace opportunities and company outings
Quarterly profit-sharing plan
Serve a noble purpose by helping patients get access to life-altering drugs

Software Developer Engineer Summary:

For over a decade, Serva Health is a premier provider of innovative technology and patient-centric support to the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries with an elite group of professionals that are smart, driven and passionate about making a difference. We are seeking a Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer to add to our growing SaaS technology development business unit. We work on exciting projects that will challenge and help you to grow your software development skills. This position will be supported by a Sr. Software Engineer who will provide guidance and mentorship for success in the role.

Software Developer Engineer Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent concentration from an accredited U.S. based institution
3+ years of post-Bachelor’s experience minimum
Good understanding of Agile software development practices
A true love of software engineering and application development
Must be a self-starter
Must be comfortable working independently or as part of a team
Proven ability to be successful at software engineering and to learn new skills quickly

Software Developer Engineer Technical Qualifications:

ASP.NET and C# development experience
SQL RDL experience
Experience with front-end responsive frameworks (such as Bootstrap)
MS SQL Server experience
Client-side scripting: JavaScript, jQuery, and any new popular framework is a plus (Angular JS, Node etc.)
.NET Core
React.js, Vue.js, and other client-side technologies
MVC architecture experience/comfort
Experience or interest within in the healthcare, clinical trial, pharmaceutical industries, or with a biopharma or CRO preferred

Who You Are:

Ability to work in the Mt Laurel, New Jersey office full time – Mt Laurel is a beautiful community touting great schools and a safe community. Philly adjacent, Mt Laurel offers all the attractions of a large city within a commutable distance and the shore within an hour!
Have a true love of software engineering and application development
Ability to excel in an agile/scrum software development environment
You value the input and ideas of others without fear and can celebrate their contribution

Who We Are:

Serva Health provides high-engagement patient support solutions and services at the best possible value through relationship-focused patient interactions, an innovative staffing and operations model, and industry-leading technologies. From clinical research patient recruiting and retention to commercial patient support programs, Serva Health has the technology and people solutions to drive superior outcomes.

At Serva Health, we are seeking employees who like to have fun and laugh together and who will bring enthusiasm and energy to a new vision of office life, with an expanded Serva Health Fitness Center, and Gaming/Relaxation Lounge, Free Food Fridays, and of course have a common shared passion for making a difference in patient outcomes in the healthcare/pharm/biotech industries.

Join our team of elite software developers, who have been chosen to work on projects for the largest Silicon Valley tech companies on the planet. We welcome all those that seek a new and exciting opportunity to expand their career horizons in this incredible company.

description:
Leading technology provider for the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industries, Serva Health, is seeking a talented and experienced Software Developer Engineer to join our team!

Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States without need for future sponsorship. We are not looking for contract (C2C) or consultant hires at this time.

Compensation: Commensurate with experience. Approximately $65,000/yr to $95,000/yr for less experienced candidates and $95,000/yr to $135,000/yr for more senior level candidates.

Location: Full-time in-office role at 1000 Bishops Gate Blvd Mount Laurel, NJ 08054. Relocation assistance is available but not visa sponsorship.

Serva Health’s Benefits Offerings:

At Serva, our people are the core of what we do. We know that the employees that work for us matter just as much as the clients that work with us.

Dental, Medical (HSA), and Vision Insurance (employer subsidized)
Long Term Disability, Life / AD&D Insurance, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
401(k) Plan with Employer Match
Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
Continued training investment
Team-oriented environment with customizable workspace opportunities and company outings
Quarterly profit-sharing plan
Serve a noble purpose by helping patients get access to life-altering drugs

Software Developer Engineer Summary:

For over a decade, Serva Health is a premier provider of innovative technology and patient-centric support to the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries with an elite group of professionals that are smart, driven and passionate about making a difference. We are seeking a Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer to add to our growing SaaS technology development business unit. We work on exciting projects that will challenge and help you to grow your software development skills. This position will be supported by a Sr. Software Engineer who will provide guidance and mentorship for success in the role.

Software Developer Engineer Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent concentration from an accredited U.S. based institution
3+ years of post-Bachelor’s experience minimum
Good understanding of Agile software development practices
A true love of software engineering and application development
Must be a self-starter
Must be comfortable working independently or as part of a team
Proven ability to be successful at software engineering and to learn new skills quickly

Software Developer Engineer Technical Qualifications:

ASP.NET and C# development experience
SQL RDL experience
Experience with front-end responsive frameworks (such as Bootstrap)
MS SQL Server experience
Client-side scripting: JavaScript, jQuery, and any new popular framework is a plus (Angular JS, Node etc.)
.NET Core
React.js, Vue.js, and other client-side technologies
MVC architecture experience/comfort
Experience or interest within in the healthcare, clinical trial, pharmaceutical industries, or with a biopharma or CRO preferred

Who You Are:

Ability to work in the Mt Laurel, New Jersey office full time – Mt Laurel is a beautiful community touting great schools and a safe community. Philly adjacent, Mt Laurel offers all the attractions of a large city within a commutable distance and the shore within an hour!
Have a true love of software engineering and application development
Ability to excel in an agile/scrum software development environment
You value the input and ideas of others without fear and can celebrate their contribution

Who We Are:

Serva Health provides high-engagement patient support solutions and services at the best possible value through relationship-focused patient interactions, an innovative staffing and operations model, and industry-leading technologies. From clinical research patient recruiting and retention to commercial patient support programs, Serva Health has the technology and people solutions to drive superior outcomes.

At Serva Health, we are seeking employees who like to have fun and laugh together and who will bring enthusiasm and energy to a new vision of office life, with an expanded Serva Health Fitness Center, and Gaming/Relaxation Lounge, Free Food Fridays, and of course have a common shared passion for making a difference in patient outcomes in the healthcare/pharm/biotech industries.

Join our team of elite software developers, who have been chosen to work on projects for the largest Silicon Valley tech companies on the planet. We welcome all those that seek a new and exciting opportunity to expand their career horizons in this incredible company.
