title: Full Stack Engineer
Full-stack Engineer
detail:
job summary:



Randstad Technologies USA is seeking a skilled Full-stack Engineer for a contract role in Seattle, WA. If you are ready to join a leader in the Retail and Technology space, please apply and Randstad will be more than happy to assist you land your next role in the Technology space. We look forward to speaking with you!





location: Seattle, Washington

job type: Contract

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors



responsibilities:



Here is some more info around the Lead Engineer (or a Senior Engineer II level) opening on my team:







The Senior Engineer II is the technical leader for a product team (my teams are specifically: Footwear, Campaigns & Community, Storytelling, Bra Quiz & Sizing, and Reviews & User Generated Content so this role would span all of these).







They are considered the technical owners of the production systems they work on and focus on how their products are delivered and how to optimize them for efficiency, security and reliability. Senior Engineer IIs may participate in on-call rotations and would provide and escalation point for production issues.







At this level, Senior Engineer IIs increase their strategic involvement. Senior Engineers IIs would dedicate a fair amount of time to the planning and discovery of tools and practices inside their given area of expertise. Working closely with Staff Engineers to promote platform level change. Senior Engineer IIs take production readiness and performance personally and help drive continuous improvement.





The Senior Engineer II is the top-level Engineer for a product team. They guide the future state of the product and work to optimize and evolve it to support our engineering standards.





The Senior Engineer II works with their local team to build and optimize a developed product or tool. They may be found working on platform teams, but usually focusing on select products or tools.





The Senior Engineer II owns their product from a DevOps standpoint. This means that they are the driving force behind the implementation of security fixes, the quality process, and all things related to delivery of a product. They would be responsible for surfacing supporting metrics and ensuring that their product exceeds the reliability expectations and SLOs they set.





The Senior Engineer II is the technical lead for a product team, they would work closely with stakeholders to establish team direction and delivery goals. They would lead a Community of Practice centred around product adoption and education.





The Senior Engineer II is the main contributor to their product roadmap. They work with Managers and Directors to ensure that product development is appropriately funded and well defined for yearly/quarterly planning initiatives. The Senior Engineer II is a regular presence in Architecture and Engineering review boards and leads these efforts for their product.





The Senior Engineer II is seen as an expert in their field, and they apply that skill, hands-on, towards the more challenging elements of their product delivery. They are mentors to other Engineers on their team and are often sharing best practices and optimization recommendations. They understand their development life cycle and work with their team to improve velocity and report key delivery metrics.





The Senior Engineer II dedicates part of their time to researching new techniques and tooling to evolve their product. They are open minded when it comes to roadmap decisions and focus on the end goals over the currently deployed technologies.





Hard skills:






5+ years experience in React.js, Next.js, and micro frontends in building web applications
5+ years experience with Python in AWS environment (if no Python experience but has Node.js I would be open to that)
Interest to work across FE and BE
BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Ability to work independently with minimal direction- a self-starter with strong initiative, and ability to manage/execute workload to deliver high quality results
GraphQL nice to have
Previous ecommerce experience nice to have
Experience integrating web frontends with complex multi-tier applications nice to have






Soft skills:






Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.
Communicates with honesty and kindness and creates the space for others to do the same.
Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn't take themselves too seriously.





qualifications:




Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 5 years of experience
Education: Bachelors


skills:
nodeJS (4 years of experience is required)
Python

title: Full-stack Engineer
Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Greetings,
Experis, a Manpower Group company has an exciting contract opportunity for a Full Stack Engineer role at Durham NC 27709. This position is a 6+ month contract for one of our key Financial clients, that offers IT for applications in Financial industry.




Job Details:
Industry: Financial
Job Role: Full Stack Engineer
Location: Durham NC 27709
Duration: 6+ Months. (Possibility for extension)

Primary Responsibilities
Working on various small medium and large scale projects.
Do Systems Analysis of user stories
Research code to understand how existing infrastructure works and recommend designs to address changes. Document technical alternatives and recommend strategy.
Develop changes and adhere to Design / Development review processes.
Unit test and support code during QA testing phase.
Provide environment support as code moves through development integration acceptance and production environments.
Communicate issues progress and status to all levels of the organization.
Conform to secure coding standards.
Deliver high quality work under tight deadlines
Work on multiple projects simultaneously
Should be willing and able to work with various technologies and programming languages. Our applications use Java/J2EE and run on Linux

Requirements

Minimum of 6-8 years development experience
5 years Java experience.
Good knowledge of Spring framework and at least 3 years of experience working on Spring based projects.
Experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit and Mockito.
Experience working in a SOA infrastructure preferable. Hands on experience working with webservices: SOAP or REST preferred.
Knowledge of client-side technologies such as JavaScript HTML5 and JQuery
Good knowledge of development build tools Git Maven Jenkins
Experience with Object Oriented Analysis and Design
Experience with Agile Methodology a plus
Bachelor's Degree or applicable work experience plus 5 years of experience in a software engineering and development role

Thank You!
Shyam Chavan
https://www.linkedin.com/in/shyam-chavan-b0b312a3/

title: Full Stack Engineer
Remote Full Stack Engineer
detail:
As the Full Stack Engineer, you will work with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to analyze, architect and build solutions based on business needs.

Client Details

The client is a Fortune 500 Company in the beauty and retail space. They have a strong commitment to company culture, work life balance, and creating a diverse workforce.

Description



You will be working with a team of skilled Full Stack Developers to implement Omnichannel capabilities, with a focus on providing excellent user experience


Work with Perl and PHP on the Backend to expand the use of React


Work with the team leadership and business owners to define scalable technical solutions


Code review and mentor junior Engineers



Profile



You have 2+ years of Front End Web Development experience with expertise in JavaScript


You have 3+ years of Back End Development experience with expertise in Perl, PHP, or NodeJS


You have experience mentoring engineers and working with the product teams to define and drive solutions


You have experience working with an Agile team and with Jira


Experience with React is a plus



Job Offer



Hourly rates ranging from $80-$90/hr


Opt-In benefits through Michael Page


Work remotely from anywhere in the United States


8 hour days and 40 hour weeks


Collaborative and inclusive work environment


Click Apply to have your resume considered



MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Duration: 6+Months




Location: Smithfield, RI /Boston MA (Onsite)







Top Skills:





Java (1.8)


Angular 2+

title: Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE (3977)
detail:
Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE







Why you want to work at Flexion:




We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer that is looking for an opportunity to grow their DevOps Engineering skills and knowledge. We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer with expertise in .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages that is interested in expanding their skillset to include Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure configuration and automation. . You will have an unwavering passion for working in autonomous, cross-functional, self-organized teams to build complex systems using lean, agile mindsets-this means delivering incremental business value with each sprint and enabling options at all scales. For this project, you and your team will be modernizing a critical state government system and helping to improve the lives of millions of state residents.







At Flexion (an agile software company that's been delivering excellence for over 24 years), our company culture is built on autonomy, trust, and transparency. We empower teams to remain autonomous and self-organized by hiring people who can solve complex problems by functioning collaboratively-this means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles (business application software engineering, database engineering, DevSecOps, security engineering, etc.) as needed. Every member within a cross-functional team is a leader who takes responsibility for the entire team's success, which mirrors the company's overall flat structure.







What the job looks like:




You'll be part of a multi-disciplinary, agile application development team tasked with modernizing an enterprise government system. The project work is primarily remote but may require some client on-site work estimated at <5%.





Mobbing and pairing with your team to design, code, test, debug, deploy and document software in an agile environment


Working with your team, supporting agile engineering practices such as delivering small narrow slices of functionality, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment, and Infrastructure as Code


Working with UX/UI Designers, DevSecOps Engineers, Full Stack Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Data Analysts to modernize a 50 year old legacy system


Tackle a wide variety of technical problems


Exercise your full tool-belt of skills and experience








Why we want to hire you:




You thrive working in a dynamic environment and think, design, and code with the knowledge that things will change. You want to work with team members that challenge you every day. You demonstrate an unwavering commitment to human-centered agility, quality, and technical excellence. You have read and have a strong alignment to our Flexion Fundamentals.







You have:





5+ years of software engineering experience


An interest in increasing your DevOps Engineering skills and experience


A bachelor's degree or commensurate experience


Self-motivated with strong communication and collaboration skills


Passion for learning new technologies and the ability to do so quickly


Ability to write high-quality code efficiently


Agile software development experience


Advanced knowledge and experience with .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages


Experience building service-oriented APIs


Experience with Google Cloud or AWS Cloud platforms or Azure


Experience building applications that integrate application logging, monitoring and alerting


Experience automating Cloud Platform infrastructure using Terraform/CloudFormation desired


DevOps, Continuous Delivery & Automation using tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Packer, CloudBees Jenkins, Nexus desired


Experience modernizing legacy mainframe systems desired


Experience solving complex problems and implementing solutions for performance and scalability








At Flexion, we live by these principles:





Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutions


Welcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warning


Collaborate online in small groups about 50% of the time


Encourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options open


Expect and vocally advocate for quality first


Learn new practices and techniques as the situation demands


Ensure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or two


Do what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitude


Dig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutions


Relentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes








The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided. If you have questions or would like more information about this job posting or if you'd like to know more about Flexion Inc. in general, please contact a dedicated recruiter at (608) 352-0360.







Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer




If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 608-205-8868 for assistance.

title: Java Full Stack Engineer
Lead Full Stack Engineer
detail:
job summary:



We are looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer to work a hybrid role, requiring 2 days a week (Tuesdays and Thursdays) on-site in Dallas, TX. The remaining 3 - days can be worked from home.






Must haves: Node, React and preferably PostgreSQL but any relational database is fine
Nice to have: AWS or Azure, CI/CD, React Native, MongoDB, leadership experience
This individual will be working on all parts of the application; someone with B2C experience is a plus;
We are looking for a servant leader, someone who is proactive, friendly and focused



location: Dallas, Texas

job type: Permanent

salary: $140,000 - 150,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors



responsibilities:



We are looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer to work a hybrid role, requiring 2 days a week (Tuesdays and Thursdays) on-site in Dallas, TX. The remaining 3 - days can be worked from home.






Must haves: Node, React and preferably PostgreSQL but any relational database is fine
Nice to have: AWS or Azure, CI/CD, React Native, MongoDB, leadership experience,
This individual will be working on all parts of the application; someone with B2C experience is a plus;
We are looking for a servant leader, someone who is proactive, friendly and focused
This individual will need to be in Dallas and go into the office 2x a week (Tuesday and Thursday) for whiteboarding discussions and to meet with the marketing and operations teams
Big selling points: This individual will be working with cutting edge technology and the applications are constantly evolving. Due to company growth, the goal is to package the platform and sell it to other companies. This is a new platform and you will also have opportunity to work with some R&D.
Culture: when in office, business casual to business dress code; have employee events for people to get together; since it's a flat organization, employees don't need to go through a lot of layers to talk to people on other teams
You'll spend 50% of your time coding, other 50% will be spent leading, talking to the business side, gathering requirements, and making architecture decisions.





qualifications:




Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 5 years of experience
Education: Bachelors (required)

React (5 years of experience is required)
nodeJS (4 years of experience is required)
PostgreSQL (4 years of experience is preferred)

subTitle:
Braintrust
4 reviews
San Francisco, CA
Remote
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone:PST/CIST | Partial overlap)
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $80 – $120/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 30 hrs/wk - short-term

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements

Must Haves

You can ship both BE and FE code

You know modern languages

Nice to Haves

You have been a freelancer before

You can set up infrastructure on AWS

The Ideal Candidates

Smart, works fast, understands how to build an MVP, makes decisions and doesn't need someone telling them what to do, has an opinion about technical decisions

Project Overview

Help us enable our distributed community top AI and ML talent to better connect with one another by creating captivating profiles, showing off their skills, and demonstrating how they can best help one another.

We're looking for a FS dev as there will be both BE and FE work that needs to be done as well as setting up some light infrastructure on AWS.

We think most of the work can be done hooking up existing APIs from our multiple services.

We're looking to ship an MVP ASAP but have a long list of features and deep roadmap that we want to pursue.

First Few Deliverables

Sign up / login page

Email automations

Create and edit profile

Apply Now!


ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we'd welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we'd welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Full Stack Engineer [Remote]

description:
AuctusIQ is a rapidly growing, revenue intelligence company specializing in software applications for salesforces, such as algorithms that forecast and predict deal win probability. We are looking for a talented Full-Stack or Front-End Developer to work directly for our CTO on our production web applications.

React / Node / Firebase - Remote - Flexible Hours - Full or Part time. More information on how we can work together below...

You can…

Take ownership of your work from scoping to shipping to maintaining. We’re a small crew, so you’ll be responsible for helping scope, build, test, and maintain your work over time.
Learn new technologies on your own. As we continue to evolve our product suite and improve our ability to scale up, we’ll be leveraging new technologies constantly.
Ship features and fixes early and often. “Make it work then make it better” is a guiding principle. You share this mentality and know that the best version of a product is one that’s undergone many iterations driven by client feedback, not something that’s dreamed up ahead of time then built to spec.

You are…

Equipped with the right skillset. We’re big on javascript (React, Node) and the latest cloud technologies (Google Cloud Platform, Firebase).
Upset when too many days go by without a commit. Our developers are passionate about creating software and love to code.
Focused on delivering value to customers. You’re not too caught up on building the perfect engineering solution and are just fine with shipping “good enough” features that deliver value.
Ready to ship week one. We have a complex set of solutions we deliver to clients, but we’d like to empower you to select the right project for your skills and start creating customer value your first week.

We will…

Allow you to get things done your way. With the exception of a weekly standup and the occasional ad hoc meeting, we’re flexible about when and how you get stuff done, and how you choose to take time off.
Supply you with what you need to get things done. Online classes & memberships, new hardware, a 2nd or 3rd monitor, we’re here to help you be as efficient and trained up as possible.
Let you work from anywhere. As long as you have an internet connection, we don’t care where you’re working from. If you prefer a coworking space, we can hook that up too.
Foster continuous learning and exposure to new tech. If you have a new technology you think could be useful to our products, or just want to learn some new skills, we’re supportive of finding ways to help you build and incorporate new skill sets.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $60,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Professional development assistance
Vision insurance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

Describe a web application you have built or contributed to building that you are most proud of and/or most aligns with our needs, and your role(s) in creating the application.
Describe your level of familiarity with the following technologies: Google Cloud Platform (or another major cloud services provider), NoSQL Databases, UI/UX Design, NodeJS, API development.

Education:

Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

JavaScript: 3 years (Required)
React: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Full Stack Developer

description:
Introduction
A career in IBM Consulting embraces long-term relationships, meaningful impact, and close collaboration with clients across the globe.

You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including IBM Software and Red Hat.

Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be supported by mentors and coaches who will encourage you to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and learning opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.

Your Role and Responsibilities
As an Associate Full Stack Application Developer at IBM, your analytical and technical skills will directly impact the quality of the applications we create. In your role, you will be responsible for:


Applying knowledge of event driven architecture to create and maintain technology at the back end of a website (the server, database and application)
Managing the retrieval and processing of event driven/database processes
Analyzing data to identify possible improvements in efficiency or performance.
Reviewing software code written by other developers to identify bugs and errors.
Designing and developing new applications by translating user requirements into code that can be read by a computer.
Leveraging, adapting and deploying Rest APIs
Building containers using Docker Kubernetes
Developing new user-facing features,
Determining the structure and design of web pages
Building reusable codes,
Optimizing page loading times, and
Using a variety of markup languages to create the web pages.
Researching, developing, implementing, and maintaining DevOps processes and tools to automate the integration and deployment of complex software applications.
Work within a hybrid cloud environment to manage software deployments operating within enterprise Virtual Machine (VM) and container infrastructure.
Develop scripts and configurations to automate continuous integration pipelines using industry leading tools and applications.
Collect, process, and present build, network, security, performance, and other information and metrics to show automation improvements or degradations over time.
Authoring and maintaining automation deployment and monitoring scripts
Managing virtualized and containerized assets,
Creating virtual and physical network configurations, servers, communications, and test and developer engineering support.
Collaborate with the rest of the technical team to ensure applications align with the organization’s goals, as well as customer needs
Remain current on technology trends to keep our software as innovative as possible

You must live in, or be willing to relocate to Buffalo, NY
Some travel is expected, and all candidates must be willing and able to travel to meet our client needs across the US. Travel is typically related to knowledge transfer and training at the client site. You are expected to travel up to 50% of the time.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Ability to program in at least one of the following (Java, C++, Python, Linux, Scala, R, SAS, SQL, Hadoop, HTML, SPSS, VBA, Tableau, Spark, Angular, ReactJS)
Ability to program in at least one of the following (javascipt, Java, HTML, Angular, ReactJS, CSS, typscript)
Exposure to web services, API, and multiple Java application frameworks highly desired
Ability to thrive in an ever-changing, technology-based consulting environment, using agile development techniques
Strong communication skills



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Awareness of key software development life cycles (Waterfall, Agile, SCRUM, etc)
Some coursework in computer science, information systems, or other related fields
Completed an internship or has relevant work experience with a proven track record



About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:


12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.
Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.
Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).
Select educational reimbursement opportunities.
Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.
Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
At Wellframe, we reimagine healthcare relationships through a new approach that uses high-tech to deliver the high-touch support people need, when and where they need it. We call it Digital Health Management. Our comprehensive suite of Digital Health Management solutions for care management, advocacy, and navigation help organizations forge more meaningful connections with members, across their healthcare journey.
Role Overview
The Software Engineer is responsible for building the software that enables our digital care management platform. They accomplish this by working closely with other engineers, product managers, designers, and data scientists. The Software Engineer sits within the Engineering department and reports to a Manager, Software Engineering. Success in this role is demonstrated by translating business requirements that have an impact on patient care into high-quality solutions coded with security and privacy best practices in mind.
Ideal candidate will be local to New England and be able to commute into our Boston office on a monthly basis.

Areas of Responsibility
Translate user stories into software solutions
Work closely with product managers and scrum masters to understand the business problems
Collaborate with designers to ensure we deliver the optimal user experience
Work with senior engineers to validate the approach
Write automated tests to ensure code is of the highest quality
Debug and fix production issues
Work with our customer support team to debug and fix bugs affecting our users.
Scope out complexity of future work
Work with senior engineers to develop proof of concepts and estimates for future work.

Education, Experience, & Skills Required:
3+ years of experience in software development capacity
A B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a closely related field of study preferred
Proficient in Java or Rails
Experienced with frontend frameworks such as ReactJS
Development experience building SaaS or cloud-based commercial software products
Makes good trade-offs for core design and API decisions —knows when to stick to convention, but also when to break it.
Excellent communicator, comfortable explaining technical problems and plans in person and in writing.
Values the difference between good code and correct code, and cares about test-driven development without dogma. Thrives on diverse technical challenges — our system integrates a wide variety of healthcare and other technologies.

Wellframe's remote-friendly culture means that we operate a hybrid office for employees in the Boston area, and also hire fully remotely across the country.
At Wellframe, we reimagine healthcare relationships through a new approach that uses high-tech to deliver the high-touch support people need, when and where they need it. We call it Digital Health Management. Our comprehensive suite of Digital Health Management solutions for care management, advocacy, and navigation help organizations forge more meaningful connections with members, across their healthcare journey.
Wellframe was founded to counter a pressing industry problem: the healthcare system has struggled to find ways to support people in between care settings, at scale. We believe health plans are in the best position to advocate for their members as they navigate their health and care, but know that technology alone can’t help us achieve this ambition. That’s why our team of physicians, clinicians, public health experts, data scientists, engineers, and healthcare industry experts ensure our patented technology works in service of the person-to-person connections that make healthcare work best.
Wellframe, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.
This posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee and any percentages listed are approximate. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

title: Software Engineer- Full Stack

description:
About Standard Fleet

Our mission is to accelerate business adoption of electric vehicle fleets. Electric vehicles are superior for just about every business use-case and businesses are adopting EVs quickly. Standard Fleet wants to set the standard in EV Fleet Management Software.

Standard Fleet is a team of passionate transportation enthusiasts who are excited about the electrification of transportation and are impatient about making our products better. We come from companies like Apple, Stripe, Embark, & Yelp. We’ve already gained significant customer traction with a small team and want your help to grow faster.

Standard Fleet is well-funded and backed by top Silicon Valley investors. We were founded by David Hodge, the CEO of Embark. At Embark, the team built a popular transportation App used by millions and eventually sold to Apple.

What we're looking for

Standard Fleet is seeking talented individuals who want to accelerate the world toward the electric vehicle future. You'll be an early engineer defining the future of electric mobility and be able to empower thousands of businesses to switch to Electric Vehicles. This is a rare opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the future of a nascent market with enormous growth ahead of it.

This is a rare founding engineer role with significant scope and equity.

Responsibilities

Build out full features for “Fleetweb” our integrated fleet dashboard

Expand our vehicle support to bring in more non-Tesla EV’s along to the connected EV future

Build out dozens of new features, rebuilding many existing features along the way

Work directly with the CEO daily on engineering, product

Qualifications

We don’t believe in qualification checkboxes for engineers. These often end up causing great candidates to think they’re not qualified. If you think you can help us build out our future set, let’s talk and see if we’re a fit.

You might be a good fit if...

You like shipping

You’re not afraid to move up and down the stack as-needed

You have excellent communication skills

You’re excited about talking to customers

You want to work on something important for the world

Benefits

Competitive salary & equity

Remote-first culture with flexibility to work from a location that suits you best

Top notch health, dental, & vision insurance

Generous PTO / sick leave

401(k) retirement plan

All equipment provided by Standard Fleet

How to Apply

Does this role sound like a good fit? Email us at apply@standardfleet.com and we’ll get rolling!

title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer
detail:
Leading technology provider for the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industries, Serva Health, is seeking a talented and experienced Software Developer Engineer to join our team!

Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States without need for future sponsorship. We are not looking for contract (C2C) or consultant hires at this time.

Compensation: Commensurate with experience. Approximately $65,000/yr to $95,000/yr for less experienced candidates and $95,000/yr to $135,000/yr for more senior level candidates.

Location: Full-time in-office role at 1000 Bishops Gate Blvd Mount Laurel, NJ 08054. Relocation assistance is available but not visa sponsorship.

Serva Health’s Benefits Offerings:

At Serva, our people are the core of what we do. We know that the employees that work for us matter just as much as the clients that work with us.

Dental, Medical (HSA), and Vision Insurance (employer subsidized)
Long Term Disability, Life / AD&D Insurance, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
401(k) Plan with Employer Match
Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
Continued training investment
Team-oriented environment with customizable workspace opportunities and company outings
Quarterly profit-sharing plan
Serve a noble purpose by helping patients get access to life-altering drugs

Software Developer Engineer Summary:

For over a decade, Serva Health is a premier provider of innovative technology and patient-centric support to the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries with an elite group of professionals that are smart, driven and passionate about making a difference. We are seeking a Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer to add to our growing SaaS technology development business unit. We work on exciting projects that will challenge and help you to grow your software development skills. This position will be supported by a Sr. Software Engineer who will provide guidance and mentorship for success in the role.

Software Developer Engineer Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent concentration from an accredited U.S. based institution
3+ years of post-Bachelor’s experience minimum
Good understanding of Agile software development practices
A true love of software engineering and application development
Must be a self-starter
Must be comfortable working independently or as part of a team
Proven ability to be successful at software engineering and to learn new skills quickly

Software Developer Engineer Technical Qualifications:

ASP.NET and C# development experience
SQL RDL experience
Experience with front-end responsive frameworks (such as Bootstrap)
MS SQL Server experience
Client-side scripting: JavaScript, jQuery, and any new popular framework is a plus (Angular JS, Node etc.)
.NET Core
React.js, Vue.js, and other client-side technologies
MVC architecture experience/comfort
Experience or interest within in the healthcare, clinical trial, pharmaceutical industries, or with a biopharma or CRO preferred

Who You Are:

Ability to work in the Mt Laurel, New Jersey office full time – Mt Laurel is a beautiful community touting great schools and a safe community. Philly adjacent, Mt Laurel offers all the attractions of a large city within a commutable distance and the shore within an hour!
Have a true love of software engineering and application development
Ability to excel in an agile/scrum software development environment
You value the input and ideas of others without fear and can celebrate their contribution

Who We Are:

Serva Health provides high-engagement patient support solutions and services at the best possible value through relationship-focused patient interactions, an innovative staffing and operations model, and industry-leading technologies. From clinical research patient recruiting and retention to commercial patient support programs, Serva Health has the technology and people solutions to drive superior outcomes.

At Serva Health, we are seeking employees who like to have fun and laugh together and who will bring enthusiasm and energy to a new vision of office life, with an expanded Serva Health Fitness Center, and Gaming/Relaxation Lounge, Free Food Fridays, and of course have a common shared passion for making a difference in patient outcomes in the healthcare/pharm/biotech industries.

Join our team of elite software developers, who have been chosen to work on projects for the largest Silicon Valley tech companies on the planet. We welcome all those that seek a new and exciting opportunity to expand their career horizons in this incredible company.

The orchestration component is specifically supporting Cisco's Enterprise networking products based on Kubernetes.








Solid full stack development skills in Python (Django, Flask), Javascript and/or similar technologies.
Good understanding of REST APIs, JSON, Experience with Postgres, MongoDB Redis, Asynchonous Task Management
Solid frontend development skills, particularly in React or similar technologies
Unit testing, E2E testing, Selenium Docker, K8s*, Helm* Elasticsearch, Grafana Git, CI/CD, Jenkins
Preferred: Passionate about developer production and efficiency Ability to learn new technologies quickly strong communication skills, both verbal and written

title: Full Stack Engineer
Full-stack Engineer
detail:
job summary:



Randstad Technologies USA is seeking a skilled Full-stack Engineer for a contract role in Seattle, WA. If you are ready to join a leader in the Retail and Technology space, please apply and Randstad will be more than happy to assist you land your next role in the Technology space. We look forward to speaking with you!





location: Seattle, Washington

job type: Contract

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors



responsibilities:



Here is some more info around the Lead Engineer (or a Senior Engineer II level) opening on my team:







The Senior Engineer II is the technical leader for a product team (my teams are specifically: Footwear, Campaigns & Community, Storytelling, Bra Quiz & Sizing, and Reviews & User Generated Content so this role would span all of these).







They are considered the technical owners of the production systems they work on and focus on how their products are delivered and how to optimize them for efficiency, security and reliability. Senior Engineer IIs may participate in on-call rotations and would provide and escalation point for production issues.







At this level, Senior Engineer IIs increase their strategic involvement. Senior Engineers IIs would dedicate a fair amount of time to the planning and discovery of tools and practices inside their given area of expertise. Working closely with Staff Engineers to promote platform level change. Senior Engineer IIs take production readiness and performance personally and help drive continuous improvement.





The Senior Engineer II is the top-level Engineer for a product team. They guide the future state of the product and work to optimize and evolve it to support our engineering standards.





The Senior Engineer II works with their local team to build and optimize a developed product or tool. They may be found working on platform teams, but usually focusing on select products or tools.





The Senior Engineer II owns their product from a DevOps standpoint. This means that they are the driving force behind the implementation of security fixes, the quality process, and all things related to delivery of a product. They would be responsible for surfacing supporting metrics and ensuring that their product exceeds the reliability expectations and SLOs they set.





The Senior Engineer II is the technical lead for a product team, they would work closely with stakeholders to establish team direction and delivery goals. They would lead a Community of Practice centred around product adoption and education.





The Senior Engineer II is the main contributor to their product roadmap. They work with Managers and Directors to ensure that product development is appropriately funded and well defined for yearly/quarterly planning initiatives. The Senior Engineer II is a regular presence in Architecture and Engineering review boards and leads these efforts for their product.





The Senior Engineer II is seen as an expert in their field, and they apply that skill, hands-on, towards the more challenging elements of their product delivery. They are mentors to other Engineers on their team and are often sharing best practices and optimization recommendations. They understand their development life cycle and work with their team to improve velocity and report key delivery metrics.





The Senior Engineer II dedicates part of their time to researching new techniques and tooling to evolve their product. They are open minded when it comes to roadmap decisions and focus on the end goals over the currently deployed technologies.





Hard skills:






5+ years experience in React.js, Next.js, and micro frontends in building web applications
5+ years experience with Python in AWS environment (if no Python experience but has Node.js I would be open to that)
Interest to work across FE and BE
BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Ability to work independently with minimal direction- a self-starter with strong initiative, and ability to manage/execute workload to deliver high quality results
GraphQL nice to have
Previous ecommerce experience nice to have
Experience integrating web frontends with complex multi-tier applications nice to have






Soft skills:






Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.
Communicates with honesty and kindness and creates the space for others to do the same.
Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn't take themselves too seriously.





qualifications:




Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 5 years of experience
Education: Bachelors


skills:
nodeJS (4 years of experience is required)
Python

title: Full-stack Engineer
Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Greetings,
Experis, a Manpower Group company has an exciting contract opportunity for a Full Stack Engineer role at Durham NC 27709. This position is a 6+ month contract for one of our key Financial clients, that offers IT for applications in Financial industry.




Job Details:
Industry: Financial
Job Role: Full Stack Engineer
Location: Durham NC 27709
Duration: 6+ Months. (Possibility for extension)

Primary Responsibilities
Working on various small medium and large scale projects.
Do Systems Analysis of user stories
Research code to understand how existing infrastructure works and recommend designs to address changes. Document technical alternatives and recommend strategy.
Develop changes and adhere to Design / Development review processes.
Unit test and support code during QA testing phase.
Provide environment support as code moves through development integration acceptance and production environments.
Communicate issues progress and status to all levels of the organization.
Conform to secure coding standards.
Deliver high quality work under tight deadlines
Work on multiple projects simultaneously
Should be willing and able to work with various technologies and programming languages. Our applications use Java/J2EE and run on Linux

Requirements

Minimum of 6-8 years development experience
5 years Java experience.
Good knowledge of Spring framework and at least 3 years of experience working on Spring based projects.
Experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit and Mockito.
Experience working in a SOA infrastructure preferable. Hands on experience working with webservices: SOAP or REST preferred.
Knowledge of client-side technologies such as JavaScript HTML5 and JQuery
Good knowledge of development build tools Git Maven Jenkins
Experience with Object Oriented Analysis and Design
Experience with Agile Methodology a plus
Bachelor's Degree or applicable work experience plus 5 years of experience in a software engineering and development role

Thank You!
Shyam Chavan
https://www.linkedin.com/in/shyam-chavan-b0b312a3/

title: Full Stack Engineer
Remote Full Stack Engineer
detail:
As the Full Stack Engineer, you will work with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to analyze, architect and build solutions based on business needs.

Client Details

The client is a Fortune 500 Company in the beauty and retail space. They have a strong commitment to company culture, work life balance, and creating a diverse workforce.

Description



You will be working with a team of skilled Full Stack Developers to implement Omnichannel capabilities, with a focus on providing excellent user experience


Work with Perl and PHP on the Backend to expand the use of React


Work with the team leadership and business owners to define scalable technical solutions


Code review and mentor junior Engineers



Profile



You have 2+ years of Front End Web Development experience with expertise in JavaScript


You have 3+ years of Back End Development experience with expertise in Perl, PHP, or NodeJS


You have experience mentoring engineers and working with the product teams to define and drive solutions


You have experience working with an Agile team and with Jira


Experience with React is a plus



Job Offer



Hourly rates ranging from $80-$90/hr


Opt-In benefits through Michael Page


Work remotely from anywhere in the United States


8 hour days and 40 hour weeks


Collaborative and inclusive work environment


Click Apply to have your resume considered

listInfo: Full Stack engineer who is interested in learning DevOps
title: Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE (3977)
detail:
Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE







Why you want to work at Flexion:




We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer that is looking for an opportunity to grow their DevOps Engineering skills and knowledge. We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer with expertise in .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages that is interested in expanding their skillset to include Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure configuration and automation. . You will have an unwavering passion for working in autonomous, cross-functional, self-organized teams to build complex systems using lean, agile mindsets-this means delivering incremental business value with each sprint and enabling options at all scales. For this project, you and your team will be modernizing a critical state government system and helping to improve the lives of millions of state residents.







At Flexion (an agile software company that's been delivering excellence for over 24 years), our company culture is built on autonomy, trust, and transparency. We empower teams to remain autonomous and self-organized by hiring people who can solve complex problems by functioning collaboratively-this means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles (business application software engineering, database engineering, DevSecOps, security engineering, etc.) as needed. Every member within a cross-functional team is a leader who takes responsibility for the entire team's success, which mirrors the company's overall flat structure.







What the job looks like:




You'll be part of a multi-disciplinary, agile application development team tasked with modernizing an enterprise government system. The project work is primarily remote but may require some client on-site work estimated at <5%.





Mobbing and pairing with your team to design, code, test, debug, deploy and document software in an agile environment


Working with your team, supporting agile engineering practices such as delivering small narrow slices of functionality, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment, and Infrastructure as Code


Working with UX/UI Designers, DevSecOps Engineers, Full Stack Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Data Analysts to modernize a 50 year old legacy system


Tackle a wide variety of technical problems


Exercise your full tool-belt of skills and experience








Why we want to hire you:




You thrive working in a dynamic environment and think, design, and code with the knowledge that things will change. You want to work with team members that challenge you every day. You demonstrate an unwavering commitment to human-centered agility, quality, and technical excellence. You have read and have a strong alignment to our Flexion Fundamentals.







You have:





5+ years of software engineering experience


An interest in increasing your DevOps Engineering skills and experience


A bachelor's degree or commensurate experience


Self-motivated with strong communication and collaboration skills


Passion for learning new technologies and the ability to do so quickly


Ability to write high-quality code efficiently


Agile software development experience


Advanced knowledge and experience with .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages


Experience building service-oriented APIs


Experience with Google Cloud or AWS Cloud platforms or Azure


Experience building applications that integrate application logging, monitoring and alerting


Experience automating Cloud Platform infrastructure using Terraform/CloudFormation desired


DevOps, Continuous Delivery & Automation using tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Packer, CloudBees Jenkins, Nexus desired


Experience modernizing legacy mainframe systems desired


Experience solving complex problems and implementing solutions for performance and scalability








At Flexion, we live by these principles:





Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutions


Welcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warning


Collaborate online in small groups about 50% of the time


Encourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options open


Expect and vocally advocate for quality first


Learn new practices and techniques as the situation demands


Ensure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or two


Do what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitude


Dig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutions


Relentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes








The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided. If you have questions or would like more information about this job posting or if you'd like to know more about Flexion Inc. in general, please contact a dedicated recruiter at (608) 352-0360.







Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer




If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 608-205-8868 for assistance.

description:
Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE







Why you want to work at Flexion:




We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer that is looking for an opportunity to grow their DevOps Engineering skills and knowledge. We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer with expertise in .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages that is interested in expanding their skillset to include Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure configuration and automation. . You will have an unwavering passion for working in autonomous, cross-functional, self-organized teams to build complex systems using lean, agile mindsets-this means delivering incremental business value with each sprint and enabling options at all scales. For this project, you and your team will be modernizing a critical state government system and helping to improve the lives of millions of state residents.







At Flexion (an agile software company that's been delivering excellence for over 24 years), our company culture is built on autonomy, trust, and transparency. We empower teams to remain autonomous and self-organized by hiring people who can solve complex problems by functioning collaboratively-this means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles (business application software engineering, database engineering, DevSecOps, security engineering, etc.) as needed. Every member within a cross-functional team is a leader who takes responsibility for the entire team's success, which mirrors the company's overall flat structure.







What the job looks like:




You'll be part of a multi-disciplinary, agile application development team tasked with modernizing an enterprise government system. The project work is primarily remote but may require some client on-site work estimated at <5%.





Mobbing and pairing with your team to design, code, test, debug, deploy and document software in an agile environment


Working with your team, supporting agile engineering practices such as delivering small narrow slices of functionality, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment, and Infrastructure as Code


Working with UX/UI Designers, DevSecOps Engineers, Full Stack Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Data Analysts to modernize a 50 year old legacy system


Tackle a wide variety of technical problems


Exercise your full tool-belt of skills and experience








Why we want to hire you:




You thrive working in a dynamic environment and think, design, and code with the knowledge that things will change. You want to work with team members that challenge you every day. You demonstrate an unwavering commitment to human-centered agility, quality, and technical excellence. You have read and have a strong alignment to our Flexion Fundamentals.







You have:





5+ years of software engineering experience


An interest in increasing your DevOps Engineering skills and experience


A bachelor's degree or commensurate experience


Self-motivated with strong communication and collaboration skills


Passion for learning new technologies and the ability to do so quickly


Ability to write high-quality code efficiently


Agile software development experience


Advanced knowledge and experience with .NET or Java, React, or other modern languages


Experience building service-oriented APIs


Experience with Google Cloud or AWS Cloud platforms or Azure


Experience building applications that integrate application logging, monitoring and alerting


Experience automating Cloud Platform infrastructure using Terraform/CloudFormation desired


DevOps, Continuous Delivery & Automation using tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Packer, CloudBees Jenkins, Nexus desired


Experience modernizing legacy mainframe systems desired


Experience solving complex problems and implementing solutions for performance and scalability








At Flexion, we live by these principles:





Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutions


Welcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warning


Collaborate online in small groups about 50% of the time


Encourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options open


Expect and vocally advocate for quality first


Learn new practices and techniques as the situation demands


Ensure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or two


Do what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitude


Dig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutions


Relentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes








The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided. If you have questions or would like more information about this job posting or if you'd like to know more about Flexion Inc. in general, please contact a dedicated recruiter at (608) 352-0360.







Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer




If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 608-205-8868 for assistance.

description:
REMOTE Role for Full Stack Developer, has to be in USA.

Attempt to farm out this job would not work. Interview is video so are the scrums for the selected candidate.

Requirements:

Track record delivering front-end software that is correct, stable, performant, secure, and accessibility compliant.
Minimum 3+ years of SPA development experience on a framework [VueJS would be a plus]
Proficient in a broad range of software design approaches and common UX patterns. Knows when (and when not) to use front-end software design patterns (e.g., asynchronicity, data binding, modules, objects, promises).
Proficient in view layout and rendering technologies (e.g., responsiveness, progressive enhancement, browser/device support). Knows when it is appropriate to make graceful fallbacks.
Experience with frontend data or visualization frameworks (preferably D3 and Plotly) is a plus
Experience with REST APIs
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English

What you'll do:

100% remote work with a team of other developers and QA engineers to deliver new business values within a product development team
Work with your Product Owner to refine, design and implement business case improvements
Implement processes and functionalities within a large eco-system of microservices all the while focusing on frontend code only

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Experience:

REST: 2 years (Required)
Full-stack development: 5 years (Required)
SPA: 3 years (Required)
D3.js: 3 years (Preferred)
Plotly: 3 years (Preferred)
Vue.js: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Senior Full Stack Software Engineer

Engineers create the world!

Are you looking to be part of an Engineering-First culture? Do you want to work for an organization where IT strategy is key in delivering Business objectives? Does it excite you to use technology to make meaningful impact in the daily lives of millions of people?

John Hancock’s Digital Engineering team is working on delivering business and technical capabilities to enhance customer experience. Out company’s mission of “Decisions Made Easier, Lives Made Better” is directly supported by the work we do in Digital Engineering. We use cloud-native, best-in-class technology and modern Engineering practices to deliver on Business Outcomes.

We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join our team to help us with our goal of continuing to be a digital leader in our industry.

What Tools/Technology Would I be Using?

Here are some of the tools that we currently use and the stack we are implementing:

Java Springboot, C# .Net Core, Nodejs for backend development

React/ Redux and Salesforce for front end application development

Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL

Jira for task management

Teamcity, Snyk, Azure Kubernetes Service, and SonarQube and more for a DevOps and environment chain

GitHub for source control

What Work Would I be Doing?

The person in this job must have a constant learner’s mindset. As part of this position, we expect the candidates to be strong coders and act as a technical lead for the squad they are working on. The team focuses on Security Customer Identity and Access Management and covers a wide area of responsibility starting from the Front end and all the way to the vendor platform. While the ideal candidate does not have to be proficient in all areas, they need to have enough understanding in each area and be experienced in Security standards and or Identity and Access Management. Responsibilities include:

Create and test high quality APIs using a mix of internal and open-source libraries

Pair program with other software engineers to learn, coach, and mentor

Help enhance and maintain our performance and reliability capabilities using tools like New Relic, Data Dog and Devo for performance monitoring, end-to-end logging, and other telemetry data

Excellent work ethic and strong sense of ownership and pride in the work they do. Willingness to learn new skills.

Enjoy your job!

Am I Right for the Job?

We're looking for a passionate, motivated individual to join our team's exciting journey as we grow, pioneer, and innovate. Experience with any or all the tools/technology we use is a huge plus, but don't let one of those list items deter you! If you're excited by the notion of joining a team that is going to disrupt a market and have fun doing it, we want to hear from you! No one knows everything, but a constant learner’s mindset is key. Minimum 5 to 7 years of relevant senior level experience is preferred.

Why is this job Important?

As a market leader, John Hancock is committed to provide a best-in-class experience to our end users. Technology is the most important factor in our ability to provide that experience and generate business.

What Will I Learn on this Job?

You will learn and thrive as part of a large organization which at the same has the flexibility transparency and a “go-getter” culture of a startup. You will have access to best-in-class technology and partners which is something that comes with being part of an organization this size. You will have an opportunity to develop both technically as well as understand how businesses work.

What about Perks?

Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to:

Competitive compensation

Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account)

Manulife Share Ownership Program with employer matching

Customizable Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and 100% of Mental Health expenses

Financial support for ongoing training, learning, and education.

No dress code! We trust you to make good choices and dress for your day – wherever your day takes you

An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance which only comes at a company this size.

Access to world-class leadership team who can mentor and guide your career path. Open culture where hard work, commitment and collaboration is recognized and rewarded.

A flexible work environment with flex hours, work from home arrangements, distributed teams.

Numerous clubs and opportunities to be part of the Manulife Family.

Ok, I'm Sold. Now what?

Send us a resume telling us about yourself and why you want to work with us! We're excited to hear from you!

#LI-JH

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

description:
Description:

As a Senior Full Stack Developer you are an experienced full-stack developer. You are willing to mentor mid-level developers and build infrastructure and processes. You will help us make our brands’ web presence as high quality as our products. You are driven to create a dynamic and consumer-friendly experience.

Lead the development of new features and functionality on the Bellami websites
Build server-side applications
Re-write or re-architect websites to improve standards, stability, speed, and usability
Facilitate API, apps, and backend integrations to support business goals
Collaborate with other team members to ensure they are meeting requirements and standards
Engage in a scrum team environment working closely with product owners, scrum masters, and other team members to deliver value in each sprint
Agile mindset — help drive the agile process through sprints and daily standups
Debug, troubleshoot, and review code to identify issues and resolve them
Create rapid prototypes, demos, and demonstration functionality while being open to feedback

Who We Are:

We are leaders in our industry, and you want our websites to reflect this with best-in-class performance and user experience. We are a growing team that is skilled and excited to do quality work with a high degree of follow-through. We take pride in our work and thrive on creating a measurable impact on customer satisfaction while attaining company goals.

Requirements:
5+ years of professional web development experience
Expert knowledge in developing responsive web applications with JavaScript and related frameworks (React, Vue, etc.)
Knowledge of server-side programming languages and frameworks such as Node.js, Python and working with open-source libraries
Ability to build API-driven integrations with various platforms (CRM, ERP, and other major systems)
Mobile first development experience

Nice to haves:

Experience with UI and UX best practices
Experience working with both local and distributed workforce
E-commerce experience

Beauty Industry Group is a leading consumer beauty products company with an exciting and growing portfolio of beauty brands. The BIG portfolio consists of several recognized, highly reputable hair extension brands that span a variety of distribution channels. Across its brands, BIG is the largest hair extension business in the U.S. and one of the largest globally, with a focus on the professional extensions segment.

With more than 300 team members, BIG is a unique, empowering place to work for motivated professionals who hunger to see the impact their work is making. The management team is young and entrepreneurial and has fostered a powerful culture that celebrates excellence, transparency, diversity, and integrity.

The company headquarters are located in Salt Lake City, Utah, with additional offices in Florida, California, New Jersey, Arizona, Australia, Germany, Canada, and the UK.
